alert.note: Alert for Mason; McCulloch; Menard; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 7:24PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern McCulloch, southeastern Menard, northern Mason and southwestern San Saba Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 722 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Hext to east of Mason, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason, Art, Pontotoc, Fredonia, Camp San Saba, Streeter, Camp Air, Long Mountain, Calf Creek, Grit, Katemcy, Hext, Voca, Erna, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222, Us- 190 Near The Menard-Mcculloch County Line and Koockville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
